description:
BOINC Manager installs with the push of a button, and if you have a Science United account, it can be up and running in no time. However, I've had significantly more problems in a few weeks with Linux than I had over months on Windows 10:
Errors saying "VirtualBox is not installed" even if I install VirtualBox using Discover.
The app thinks I have an AMD GPU even though I only have integrated graphics. It constantly downloads and instantly fails GPU-based tasks.
The app doesn't appear to always enforce CPU usage values or "suspend" commands, though that could just be an issue with the current task I have running.
Tasks stay suspended forever if I set the app to suspend based on mouse movement.
The app doesn't appear as a System Tray icon while running in the background.
Sometimes when I must relaunch BOINC multiple times because all the buttons are grayed out and no tasks are listed.
But at the end of the day, I can wrangle BOINC Manager into a working state, so I'm not too upset.
summary: Not as flawless as the Windows 10 version

description: He sido usuario del programa por SETI@home. Una pena que haya cerrado. Aún así, he retomado el uso del manejador de proyectos para ser parte de otros. Si eres de espíritu solidario, no dudes en unirte a cualquiera de los proyectos que alberga.
